response.skills: Leadership, Online gas chromatography, UniSim, AutoCAD, Minitab, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Excel, Chemical Engineering, Research, Gas Chromatography, Microsoft PowerPoint, Aspen HYSYS, Matlab, English, Aspen Plus, AutoCAD Plant 3D, Headspace gas chromatography, Karl Fischer Titration, High-Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC), Inductively Coupled Plasma

profile_positions.description:
• Customize, maintain, and install Online Gas Chromatogram (GC) for Chemical analysis of streams such as feed and product obtained from Petrochemical process for evaluation of new technologies (Adsorbents, catalysts, new processes designs). 
• Building valve systems for sampling streams and obtaining reliable analysis on stream composition. 
• Monitor up to 13 online gas chromatograms connected to different petrochemical processes.
• Supporting troubleshooting on different pilot plants, in conjunction with pilot plant technicians and researchers, when issues with mass balances and yields arose due to Online GC instrumentation failures, leaks, bad processes conditions, and failure on processes control instrumentation.
• Perform validation of analytical methods and associated data generated by the installed analytical instrument base.
• Supervise and train new employees on Online GC team activities such as an evaluation of processes flow diagram of valve systems, processing and reviewing data, building new analytical instrumentation, and providing guidance on instrument issues.
profile_positions.title: Engineer/Scientist II

profile_positions.description:
•	Review data and create analysis for justification of specification report and stability summary for 
Drug Substance and Drug Product for NDA submission 
•	Lead and Oversight analytical testing for pilot plant campaigns to produce drug substances, and 
working cross functional with Process R&D, Quality Assurance (QA), and Warehouse to make sure 
In-process, Starting materials, and final API are tested and released on timely manner, and action is 
taken over unexpected results.
•	Contribute to biweekly cross functional meetings on presenting Process Control Justification (PCJ) 
data results, updates on method development and results and results on method co-validation. Create 
and review work instructions, protocols and validation reports for Stage I and Stage II analytical 
methods. 
•	Support GMP and GSP Analytical testing, and develop, review and validate of analytical methods 
by using Gas Chromatography (GC), GC with Mass Spectra (GC/MS), GC with Head Space unit 
(HS/GC), High Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC), UPLC, Ion Chromatography (IC), 
KF-oven, KF-Coulometric and KF-volumetric techniques for different Drug Substance projects.
•	Author training documents for using electronic notebook, and Karl Fisher (KF) Tiamo software. 
Trainer on Electronic Notebook, KF Techniques and GC and Liquid Chromatography with Mass 
Spectra (LC-MS) instrumentation. 
• 	Performance on Maintenance, troubleshooting and qualification on GC and KF units.
•	Implementation of electronic documentation and folder structure on R&D organization and 
implement 5S in labs for maximizing efficiency of labs.
profile_positions.title: Associate Scientist I/II

profile_positions.description:
Perform analytical test for in-process, raw materials and finished products samples by HPLC, HS-GC, KF, 
GC, IC, GC/MS, LC/MS, Thermo Gravimetric Analysis (TGA), ROI and inductively coupled plasma (ICP)
in compliance with good manufacturing practices. Additionally, assisting in the development of analytical methods and method qualification.
profile_positions.title: Chemist I

profile_positions.description:
• 	Perform analytical tests on raw materials, finished products, in-process samples by HPLC, GC and other analytical instruments in accordance with the company and USP specifications.
• 	Conduct periodic internal audits on the whole manufacturing plant to ensure compliance with GMP’s. 
• 	Review documents of products meeting specification requirements, errors and check for good documentation practice.
profile_positions.title: Quality Control Chemist

profile_positions.description:
Teaching assistant in Chemical Process Control course.
•   Evaluated work from students in the Chemical Process Control course.
•   Provided office hours for Chemical Process Control course for helping and advising students with homework and exams.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

company.name: Instituto Departamental de Salud Norte de santander

profile_positions.company: Instituto Departamental de Salud Norte de santander
profile_positions.description:
•	Analyzed foods such as salt, milk, and alcoholic beverages.
•	Determined characteristics of food such as fat percentage, acidity, water percentage, and additives.
•	Identified chlorides, starch, formaldehyde, phosphatase, methanol, and alcohol.
profile_positions.title: Ingeniero profesional

profile_positions.description:
Established conditions for preparing emulsions by varying the pH, the procedure of mixing and the concentration of surfactants for creating stable emulsions.
•   Coordinated and implemented activities for installation and commissioning on a reactor of 16 liters capacity by checking old
reactor, and doing a P&ID plot of the reactor.
•   Supported activities for obtaining sorbitan monolaurate at laboratory and on a reactor of 16 liters capacity by calculating reaction kinetics of the esterification process.
profile_positions.title: Internship in Research and Development - R&D

company.name: Honeywell
company.description: Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address tough challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, and energy. With approximately 110,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, we have an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything we make and do.
